attributes.action: Stay on as Our Prime Minister
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Dear Sir,

Please do not give into your departing members of cabinet. At least you know that you will be left with some faithful. 

I have always been critical of the Labour Party but on this occasion, I see no reason why you should quit. Most of all, I hate the hen pecking and back stabbing. It has happened to me several times at work – I have experienced it and do not like it.

The last critical letter that I sent to you was some 3 years ago when EDEXCEL decided to remove Lord Byron poetry from the English Literature syllabus. I am a member of the International Lord Byron Society and they really did strike a nerve –of course you did not reply or my letter was not forwarded to you.

Please do not give in. Now I can see you as a leader. Stand your ground and do not quit – they can quit if they want to.

Yours Truly

Marie Otigba

reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
